intro: Popowia caesia var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated popowia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and palmate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and landscaping.
